UI_visible_response: The #MeToo movement is an awareness movement centered around the issue of sexual harassment and sexual abuse, particularly of women in the workplace, which grew to prominence in 20173. It began as a way for survivors of sexual harassment, sexual assault, and sexual bullying to bond and share their stories, eventually becoming a widespread societal reckoning8. The movement was founded in 2006 by Tarana Burke, who aimed to support survivors of sexual violence, particularly young women of color from low-wealth communities, and coined the phrase "Me Too" to empower these women4. Although it started on MySpace, the movement gained significant momentum on Twitter in 2017 when the hashtag went viral following sexual misconduct allegations7. This watershed movement has played a crucial role in advancing gender equality by highlighting the prevalence of sexual harassment and misconduct1.
traffic_visible_response: The #MeToo movement is an awareness movement centered around the issue of sexual harassment and sexual abuse, particularly of women in the workplace, which grew to prominence in 2017 [[3]]. It began as a way for survivors of sexual harassment, sexual assault, and sexual bullying to bond and share their stories, eventually becoming a widespread societal reckoning [[8]]. The movement was founded in 2006 by Tarana Burke, who aimed to support survivors of sexual violence, particularly young women of color from low-wealth communities, and coined the phrase "Me Too" to empower these women [[4]]. Although it started on MySpace, the movement gained significant momentum on Twitter in 2017 when the hashtag went viral following sexual misconduct allegations [[7]]. This watershed movement has played a crucial role in advancing gender equality by highlighting the prevalence of sexual harassment and misconduct [[1]].
